Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of deaths by stating that all 11 million people in Wuhan will die from the virus, which is not supported by evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or credible sources to support the assertion that 11 million people will die in Wuhan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that consuming the meat of the Chinese cobra is the cause of the virus outbreak, which is not confirmed or supported by scientific evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that strict measures were undertaken to stop the spread of the virus and protect healthcare workers, as reported by Chinese authorities.
Falters at times: The claim falters by making unsupported statements about the severity and spread of the virus, as well as the effectiveness of the quarantine measures.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the virus outbreak and focuses solely on the consumption of Chinese cobra meat.
